message: Branches created should be named using the following format:
{issue type}/{Jira issue ID}-{issue summary}
`issue type` - Indicates the context of the branch and should be one of:
* bug
* story
* task
`Jira issue ID` - The ID of the Jira issue associated with the commit
`issue summary` - Short 2-3 words summary about what the branch contains
Example:
* `story/DT-1048-resources-rest-endpoints`
Branches created should be named using the following format:
{story type}-{2-3 word summary}-{pivotal tracker id}
{story type} - Indicates the context of the branch and should be one of:
* bg = Bug
* ch = Chore
* ft = Feature
{2-3 word summary} - Short 2-3 words summary about what the branch contains
This can contain digits, lowercase alphabets, dash.
{pivotal tracker id} - The Id of the pivotal tracker story associated with the commit.
Example: ft-resources-rest-endpoints-111504508

Commit message should consist of header,.message: A commit message consists of a header, a body and a footer, separated by blank lines.

message: Any line of the commit message cannot be longer than 100 characters!
This allows the message to be easier to read on github as well as in various git tools.
The message header is a single line that contains succinct description
of the change containing a type, an optional scope and a subject.
This describes the kind of change that this commit is providing.
* feat (feature)
* fix (bug fix)
* chore (maintain)
* docs (documentation)
* style (formatting, missing semi colons, â€¦)
* refactor
* test (when adding missing tests)
Finished, fixed or delivered stories should be listed in the footer
prefixed with 'Finishes', 'Fixes' , or 'Delivers' keyword like this:
[Finishes #1234567]
Example of a valid PR title:
#11504508 Build out REST Endpoint for Resources (CRUD)
